place.name: PAPWORTH EVERARD
place.gazetteerText: PAPWORTH-ST. EVERARD, a parish in Caxton district, Cambridge; 3 miles N N W of Caxton, and 5 S E of Oxford r. station. Post-town, Hilton, under St. Ives. Acres, 1,091. Real property, £1, 632. Pop., 133. Houses, 22. The property is divided among a few. Pap-worth Hall is the seat of W. H. Cheere, Esq. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Ely. Value, £200.* Patron, Trinity College, Cambridge. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
